sequence:
An Easily Flustered Girl's Story

<size=45>Chapter 5 - Honolulu's Bothered</size>

scripts.say: Honolulu took a seat in the office sofa and, after a few minutes, finally began talking.
... I'm easily flustered, and I'm not honest with people. I don't really get mad at people, but I can't speak my mind to them either...
That's me, in a nutshell. And you've put up with me the whole time...
Honolulu suddenly went silent. A short while later, she started talking again, with a hint of hesitation in her voice.
... A-as I was saying... I'm not bold like Louis, and I'm not elegant like Leander.
I can't imagine myself ever cheerfully smiling like some other girls do, either...

options.content: Assure her that it's all okay
Say you like her just the way she is

scripts.say: You're a strange one, you know that? ... *H-hmph*... *Ugh*...
Honolulu sighed, got off of the sofa, then walked behind me and started gently massaging my shoulders.
Listen, I don't act grumpy like this because I want to...
I wish I could hold a friendly conversation like Louis, or sit down and enjoy a refined cup of afternoon tea like Leander...
I want to smile and make friends, I want to express my concern and offer my comfort to Helena when she seems down...
Everyone else can do it with no effort, but I just can't manage.
Commander, you have to tell me what I should do...
Honolulu exposed her weak side to me, something she's never done before.

options.content: Propose going on a date together
Clarify that it's to buy a present for Helena

scripts.say: S-sure... I-I guess we can do that.
And so, I got Honolulu to agree to a "date" with me.
